TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit Clipboard extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides static methods that facilitate transferring data to and from the system Clipboard.

remarks.format:
## Remarks All applications for [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_mswin](~/includes/tlasharptla-mswin-md.md)] share the system Clipboard, so the contents are subject to change when you switch to another application.
For a list of predefined formats available to use with the <xref:System.Windows.Clipboard> class, see the <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats> class.
**Security Alert:** For security purposes, the following points should be kept in mind.
- Paste operations need to be user initiated (Ctrl-V, Paste Menu).
- Copy can only be on user selected content.
- On copy or cut, partial trust code puts plaintext and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] on to the clipboard. Plaintext includes text, Unicode text, OEM (Object Exchange Model) text, and CSV (Comma-separated values).
- On paste, [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] will paste in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] if the source of that content is from a equally trusted or more trusted site. Specifically:
- A partial trust application can paste [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] from a full trust application.
- A partial trust application can paste [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] from a partial trust application.
- A full trust application can paste XAML only from another fully trusted application.
- A non-[!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] full trust application can examine the ApplicationTrust format on the clipboard and sanitize the XAML if appropriate.
## Examples The following example shows how to add data to the system Clipboard.
[!code-csharp[DragDrop_DragDropMiscCode#_SetData](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DragDrop_DragDropMiscCode/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#_setdata)] [!code-vb[DragDrop_DragDropMiscCode#_SetData](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DragDrop_DragDropMiscCode/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#_setdata)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Clear ();
.method public static hidebysig void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears any data from the system Clipboard.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Calling this method is equivalent to calling **OleSetClipboard**(**null**).

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool ContainsAudio ();
.method public static hidebysig bool ContainsAudio() cil managed

Docs.summary: Queries the Clipboard for the presence of data in the data format.
Docs.returns: if the Clipboard contains data in the data format; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method returns `true` only if the specified data format exists natively on the Clipboard; this method does not check for the presence of auto-convertible data formats.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool ContainsData (string format);
.method public static hidebysig bool ContainsData(string format) cil managed

Docs.param: The format of the data to look for. See for predefined formats.
Docs.summary: Queries the Clipboard for the presence of data in a specified data format.
Docs.returns: if data in the specified format is available on the Clipboard; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A query for the data format <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap> or <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.FileDrop> will return `true` if the data can be automatically converted to the specified data format. For other data formats, this method returns `true` only if the specified format is available natively on the Clipboard.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool ContainsImage ();
.method public static hidebysig bool ContainsImage() cil managed

Docs.summary: Queries the Clipboard for the presence of data in the data format.
Docs.returns: if the Clipboard contains data in the data format; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method returns `true` only if the specified data format exists natively or is available as an auto-convertible data format on the Clipboard; this method does not check for the presence of auto-convertible data formats.
A bitmap represents a computer graphic as an array of bits in memory, and these bits represent the attributes of the individual pixels in an image.

The <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText> data format denotes 16-bit character encoded Unicode, also referred to as UTF-16, and USC-2.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Windows.IDataObject GetDataObject ();
.method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.IDataObject GetDataObject() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a data object that represents the entire contents of the Clipboard.
Docs.returns: A data object that enables access to the entire contents of the system Clipboard, or if there is no data on the Clipboard.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Access to data on the system Clipboard is enabled through a *data object*, that is, an object that implements the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface. A list of predefined formats is defined by the <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats> class. Use the methods specified by <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> and fields in <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats> to examine and extract the data from the data object.
To examine the formats of data on the system Clipboard, call <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetFormats%2A> on the data object returned by this method. To retrieve data from the system Clipboard, call <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject.GetData%2A> and specify the desired data format.
The system Clipboard is shared by all applications, so data on the Clipboard is subject to change by other applications.

Docs.permission: for permission to access data on the system Clipboard. Associated enumeration: **AllClipboard**.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection GetFileDropList ();
.method public static hidebysig class System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection GetFileDropList() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string collection that contains a list of dropped files available on the Clipboard.
Docs.returns: A collection of strings, where each string specifies the name of a file in the list of dropped files on the Clipboard, or if the data is unavailable in this format.

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource GetImage ();
.method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource GetImage() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a object from the Clipboard that contains data in the format.
Docs.returns: A object that contains data in the format, or if the data is unavailable in this format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method returns a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> object, either when data is available natively or when data can be auto-converted to the <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap> data format.
A bitmap represents a computer graphic as an array of bits in memory, and these bits represent the attributes of the individual pixels in an image.

Docs.returns: A string containing the data , or an empty string if no data is available on the Clipboard.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.UnicodeText> data format denotes 16-bit character encoded Unicode, also referred to as UTF-16, and UCS-2.

Docs.summary: Returns a string containing text data on the Clipboard.
Docs.returns: A string containing text data in the specified data format, or an empty string if no corresponding text data is available.

Docs.returns: if the specified data object matches what is on the system Clipboard; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this method to determine if a data object that was previously placed on the Clipboard is still present and unmodified.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the use of this method.

Docs.exception: An error occurred when accessing the Clipboard. The exception details will include an that identifies the specific error; see .

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SetData (string format, object data);
.method public static hidebysig void SetData(string format, object data) cil managed

Docs.param: A string that specifies the format to use to store the data. See the class for a set of predefined data formats.
An object representing the data to store on the Clipboard.
Docs.summary: Stores the specified data on the Clipboard in the specified format.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method adds data with auto-conversion enabled if the corresponding data format is <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.FileDrop> or <xref:System.Windows.DataFormats.Bitmap>. Otherwise, auto-conversion is disabled.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the use of this method.
[!code-csharp[DragDrop_DragDropMiscCode#_SetData](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DragDrop_DragDropMiscCode/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#_setdata)] [!code-vb[DragDrop_DragDropMiscCode#_SetData](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DragDrop_DragDropMiscCode/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#_setdata)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SetDataObject (object data);
.method public static hidebysig void SetDataObject(object data) cil managed

Docs.param: A data object (an object that implements ) to place on the system Clipboard.
Docs.summary: Places a specified non-persistent data object on the system Clipboard.

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, data placed on the system Clipboard with <xref:System.Windows.Clipboard.SetDataObject%2A> is automatically cleared from the Clipboard when the application exits.
> [!NOTE] > The default behavior of clearing the Clipboard on application exit might differ from other implementations, which might leave data on the Clipboard on application exit rather than clearing it by default. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Clipboard.SetDataObject%2A> overload and specify the `copy` parameter as `true` if you do not want data cleared from the Clipboard on application exit. > > <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> provides a basic implementation of the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface.

Docs.exception: An error occurred when accessing the Clipboard. The exception details will include an that identifies the specific error; see .
Docs.permission: for permission to access data on the system Clipboard. Associated enumeration: **AllClipboard**.

MemberSignature.Value: public static void SetDataObject (object data, bool copy);
.method public static hidebysig void SetDataObject(object data, bool copy) cil managed

Docs.param: A data object (an object that implements ) to place on the system Clipboard.
to leave the data on the system Clipboard when the application exits; to clear the data from the system Clipboard when the application exits.
Docs.summary: Places a specified data object on the system Clipboard and accepts a Boolean parameter that indicates whether the data object should be left on the Clipboard when the application exits.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.DataObject> provides a basic implementation of the <xref:System.Windows.IDataObject> interface. <xref:System.Windows.Clipboard.IsCurrent%2A> determines the data object previously placed on the clipboard by the last <xref:System.Windows.Clipboard.SetDataObject%2A> call.
## Examples The following example demonstrates the use of this method.
[!code-csharp[DragDrop_DragDropMiscCode#_SetDataObjectIsCurrent](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DragDrop_DragDropMiscCode/CSharp/Window1.xaml.cs#_setdataobjectiscurrent)] [!code-vb[DragDrop_DragDropMiscCode#_SetDataObjectIsCurrent](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/DragDrop_DragDropMiscCode/visualbasic/window1.xaml.vb#_setdataobjectiscurrent)]

Docs.exception: An error occured when accessing the Clipboard. The exception details will include an that identifies the specific error; see .
Docs.permission: for permission to access data on the system Clipboard. Associated enumeration: **AllClipboard**.
